meanings: to take an extensive view of

related.meaning: to choose at one's own discretion

lessons.japanese: レストランからは公園全体を見渡すことができますよ。
lessons.english: You can see the whole park from the restaurant.

lessons.japanese: この城から町を見渡すことができる。
見渡すと、既に船はかなり沖の方にいた。
lessons.english: Looking around the boat was already quite far out in the open sea.

lessons.japanese: 町は見渡す限りの焼け野原であった。
lessons.english: The city, as far as the eye could see, lay in ruins.

lessons.japanese: 私の家がある丘は市の全景を見渡すことができる。
lessons.english: The hill on which my house stands commands a full view of the city.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り緑の野原が広がっていた。
lessons.english: There were green fields as far as the eye could reach.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り地面は雪で覆われていた。
lessons.english: The ground was covered with snow, as far as the eye could see.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り水以外何もなかった。
lessons.english: There was nothing but water as far as the eye could see.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り人っ子一人見えなかった。
lessons.english: As far as the eye could reach, there was no sign of life.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り砂以外何も見えなかった。
lessons.english: As far as the eye could reach, nothing was to be seen but sand.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り砂ばかりだった。
lessons.english: There was nothing but sand as far as the eye could see.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り広々とした草原で、ところどころに小さな森があった。
lessons.english: The spacious plain spread as far as the eye can see, dotted with groves here and there.
There was nothing but the ocean as far as the eye could see.

lessons.japanese: 見渡す限り一面の雪景色だった。
lessons.english: Everything was covered with snow as far as the eye could see.
